Plant Care for Kids

Just like people, plants need care and attention to stay healthy and happy! Taking care of plants is a big responsibility, but it's also lots of fun. This page will teach you all about plant care basics!

What Do Plants Need?

Water

Plants need water to live, but different plants need different amounts! Some plants like to stay moist, while others prefer to dry out between waterings. Check the soil with your finger - if it feels dry about an inch down, it's probably time to water.

Sunlight

Plants need sunlight to make their food through a process called photosynthesis. Some plants love lots of direct sun, while others prefer shade. Make sure your plants get the right amount of light for their type!

Soil

Soil gives plants nutrients and support for their roots. Different plants like different types of soil. Most houseplants like potting soil that drains well and isn't too heavy.

Air

Plants breathe too! They take in carbon dioxide and release oxygen through tiny holes in their leaves. Make sure your plants have good air circulation.

Watering Guide

How to Water Your Plants

  1. Check if your plant needs water by touching the soil - if it's dry, it's time to water!
  2. Water slowly at the base of the plant, not on the leaves
  3. Keep watering until you see water coming out of the drainage holes
  4. Empty any water that collects in the saucer under the pot
  5. Wait until the soil is dry again before watering again

Warning Signs Your Plant Needs Water:

  • Droopy, sad-looking leaves
  • Dry, crispy leaf edges
  • Soil pulling away from the sides of the pot

Warning Signs of Too Much Water:

  • Yellow leaves
  • Soggy, smelly soil
  • Mold on the soil surface
  • Mushy stems

Plant Care Through the Seasons

Spring

Plants wake up in spring! This is a good time to:

  • Start seeds indoors or plant directly in your garden
  • Begin watering more regularly as plants grow
  • Add new potting soil to indoor plants

Summer

Plants grow quickly in summer! Remember to:

  • Water more frequently because plants get thirsty in the heat
  • Move some indoor plants away from hot windows
  • Check for pests more often

Fall

Plants start to slow down in fall:

  • Reduce watering as plants grow less
  • Bring outdoor plants inside before it gets too cold
  • Collect seeds from garden flowers to plant next year

Winter

Most plants rest during winter:

  • Water much less - only when soil is very dry
  • Make sure plants get enough light during short days
  • Keep plants away from cold drafts and heaters

Common Plant Problems and Solutions

Yellow Leaves

Possible Causes: Too much water, not enough light, or not enough nutrients

Solutions: Check your watering schedule, move to a brighter spot, or add plant food

Brown Leaf Tips

Possible Causes: Not enough water, too much fertilizer, or dry air

Solutions: Water more regularly, flush the soil with water, or mist the plant

Bugs on Plants

Possible Causes: Insects like aphids, spider mites, or mealybugs

Solutions: Wash leaves with soapy water, use neem oil, or ask an adult for help

Leggy Plants

Possible Causes: Not enough light

Solutions: Move the plant to a sunnier spot or add a grow light

Plant Care Checklist

Use this checklist to make sure your plants stay happy and healthy:

  • ☐ Check your plants' soil moisture every few days
  • ☐ Rotate your plants occasionally so all sides get sunlight
  • ☐ Dust off leaves gently with a soft cloth
  • ☐ Look for any bugs or signs of problems
  • ☐ Remove any dead or yellow leaves
  • ☐ Talk to your plants! Some people think it helps them grow better!
